value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Model Performance Tuning in DAX Studio - By Marco Russo
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Marco Russo contributor to DAX Studio will be giving us a deep dive and demo around using DAX Studio for Model Performance Tuning.   You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: PowerBI.tips - Tutorial - Monkey Tool Introduction - Part 1
value.excerpt: Ken Puls an amazing MVP from Excel Guru has produced an impressive tool, Monkey Tools.  This tool is an Excel Add-in that aids business users to work quickly building Data Models.  Come join us to learn about how this tool can help you in your daily work flow.  Follow Ken  Blog: https://xlguru.ca/blog

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Using DevOps in Tabular Editor
value.excerpt: Tabular Editor is an incredible Tool that enables users to manipulate a Tabular Model at lighting speeds.  Daniel Otykier is the creator of Tabular Editor.  In this video Daniel teaches us how to use Azure DevOps with Tabular Models.  This session is definately worth your time if you work in managing

value.title: Get Data from Multiple Excel Files with Different Sheet Names into Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to use Get Data from Folder in Power BI is a very useful option. However, if your sheet names are different in the list of Excel files, then you will face a problem. In this video, I’ll explain a method you can use that works regardless of the sheet names. Download the sample files from my

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: One Dimension Filters Another Dimension in Power BI
value.excerpt: I often get this question after I explain about the star-schema. The question is that both my dimensions are filtering my fact table values, but how can I get one dimension filtering another dimension? for example, how can I get only the list of products that have been purchased by this customer? value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: The Solution Architect leads successful implementations and focuses on how solutions address the broader business and technical needs of organizations.  This module covers what it takes to get started as a Solution Architect and as key member of the overall project team.

images.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform

value.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

images.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluated measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context, and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. You’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Dynamic Rolling Average with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a dynamic 7 day or 30 day rolling average wiht DAX What-IF parameters with ease. Create a dynmaic dashboard board that provides immedicate insight.   Check me out on Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: Can I use the audit log if I'm a Power BI Admin?
value.excerpt: In this video, I answer a question I get fairly often. Can I use the audit log if I have the Power BI service administrator role assigned to me within Office 365.   I also make an announcement about the future of Guy in a Cube.  Admin portal doc - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-portal/

value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how the Power BI data region is selected. This is the what you see when you go to About Power BI and see "Your data is stored in".
